// The Eremite (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Ionised Battery, Envious Assassin, (Controlled Burst, Reservoir Burst)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 76 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4UoXFYD3DbunDEKIGDiriX?si=1957400d9e024ed5) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies and sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. The Eremite (named after a religious recluse, being the root for the word hermit), is a bit of a season 21 banger! Although the stats are below average, this should be on your list of weapons you aim to farm and craft. Fluted Barrel as the barrel perk bumps up handling and adds a dash of stability, but then go all in to battery size with ionized Battery. Enhanced Envious Assassin as the first trait column support perk bypasses the poor reload speed and can cram in up 18 shots somehow, after 15 rapid kills with other weapons, which means that you can go ham with Controlled Burst as the second column signature perk - 20% bonus damage and 10% quicker charge time, just for landing all your bolts. Alternatively in the same slot, Reservoir Burst can take your magazine size up to 20 and adds 25% damage to the first 15 shots. Either should be enough to chunk down champions or last a damage phase against a raid boss. Whether you find the Head Rush origin trait useful will depend on how often you crouch and get up again - if you do, the additional handling and reload speed is useful, if not game-changing. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, M+KB, Controller

// New Pacific Epitaph (PvE first-choice roll)
// Quick Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, (Demolitionist, Lead From Gold, Unrelenting), Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 67 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3wGaXiUGMNodLkPkGFdBd3?si=42e0db2e63a443b7) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. New Pacific Epitaph is the first kinetic slot wave frame grenade launcher, so there's no direct comparison, but compared to the energy slot versions the stats are decent. As ever, play is to get the shot speed as high as you can, so Quick Launch in the barrel and High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine are the best choices. For use against endgame minor adds, as the first trait column support perk Demolitionist (which returns 20% grenade energy on special weapons, and allows for an instant reload on a grenade throw), or Lead from Gold for ammo economy, or Unrelenting to help you stay alive all work well. In the second column as the signature Perk, Collective Action should be easy to proc with all the Elemental Pickups now available, for a 20% damage boost for 7s. The Restoration Ritual origin trait is also occasionally useful for an instant reload after proccing. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// No Survivors (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Demolitionist, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 67 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3wGaXiUGMNodLkPkGFdBd3?si=42e0db2e63a443b7) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities, particularly for solar synergy. No Survivors has decent stats - high range, handling and recoil direction but low stability. We can help that with stability options in the barrel and mag, although with the high rate of fire and high chance you'll be in CQC, any of the combat effect mag perks will work. If you missed out on an Incandescent Calus Mini-Tool, you can roll something similar by using Demolitionist in the first trait slot as the support perk, and Incandescent in the second slot as the signature perk. Incandescent kills count as weapon kills, so every energy that dies to scorch or ignite damage will grant 10% energy as well as direct kills. Add your pick of Embers of Tempering, Char, Eruption, Ashes, Mercy or Searing to turn this into a CQC add-clear beast. The Restoration Ritual origin trait is also occasionally useful for an instant reload after proccing. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Cold Comfort (PvE first-choice roll)
// Quick Launch, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, (Explosive Light, Bait and Switch, Bipod)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 67 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3wGaXiUGMNodLkPkGFdBd3?si=42e0db2e63a443b7) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors and Bosses in end-game activities. Cold Comfort has decent stats, including ammo reserves so you can get to 10 host with three reserve mods. This could be a sleeper pick for burst damage against Major enemies, and against boss enemies with short damage windows. Aggressives are the fastest-firing subfamily, in the group with the highest damage per shot. Quick Launch is the usual play for the barrel, to improve velocity. For as high a damage output as possible, Impact Casing boosts overall damage by 2.2% (doesn't sound much but remember, any mutilplicative damage starts adding up). Envious Assassin, in the first trait slot as the support perk, can get you 3 in the mag from six rapid kills - let's just say they just all fit in the barrel paracausally - and if you have the Restoration Ritual origin trait procced, that'll be four shots without reloading. Bait and Switch provides the highest damage boost - 35% when procced, but needs some setup, or Explosive Light is a 25% damage boost just for picking up some orbs. As a left-field pick though, don't throw away a bipod roll - it'll only take a small change to the perk to make it extremely competitive, doubling the barrel capacity and adding 5 to your reserves. That could mean seven shots without reloading, if you include the origin trait... Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec).|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Rapacious Appetite (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling), (Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds), Perpetual Motion, Frenzy

First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Shapeable. Rapacious Appetite is one of only two Stasis aggressive SMGs as at S21, so there's not much to compare the stats against. When everything's active, you'll be near 50 for stability, 100 Handling and Reload Speed, and have a 15% damage boost, which should make for a good kinetic slot SMG option if you need one. // A Distant Pull (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Overflow, Collective Action

First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. As at S21, A Distant Pull is the only non-raid kinetic rapid-fire sniper rifle. As you might expect, it comes with lower stats but it's still usable if you can fill the gaps. Fluted Barrel and Tactical Mag fill out Handling, Stability, Reload Speed and also max out the magazine size to 7. Overflow is laughably good on a special weapon, as a first trait column support park, doubling the magazine size just for picking up an ammo brick, even when stowed. Collective Action should be easy to proc for a 7 second 20% damage boost as your signature perk, which should be long enough for damage against a stunned Champion or Majors. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. Handling is the best thing to aim for with the barrel perk, but range and stability can be useful too. Tactical Mag gets you to the maximum of 8 rounds, so there's no point looking at Appended or Extended Mag. In the first trait column as the support perk, Overflow is great for doubling the mag size for running over an ammo brick, or Auto-Loading Holster means you can rely on a full magazine every time you pull it out. Surrounded in the second column as the signature perk boosts damage by 40% (+47% for the enhanced version). Alternatively, Trench Barrel boosts damage by 50% for three shots after a melee hit. First-choice PvE pick for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Thin Precipice is the first Strand sword, and is the fan-favourite vortex (spin-to-win) frame to boot. As with all swords, Jagged Edge is the usual choice for the blade for its increased damage. To pair with your traits, you'll want to go with heavy guard, mainly to slow your charge time. The play here is to use unpowered heavy attacks, which do a bit less damage but only cost 1 ammo, to proc Tireless Blade in the first trait column as the support perk and refund ammo for every other kill - if you're lucky you can return more ammo than you use. In the second column as the signature perk, Golden Tricorn's first stack will easily make up the reduced damage after the first kill, or Chain Reaction's AoE damage should mean you can wade into crowds of adds, while never running out of ammo. // Spare Rations (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore), (Flared Magwell, Appended Mag), (Rapid Hit, Slideshot), Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Spare Rations is in a difficult place stats-wise still having the lower stats of the old 150 Lightweight subfamily even though it's been rolled into the Adaptives. However, it's the first hand cannon that can drop with Kinetic Tremors, so it might be worth keeping around in case a rework makes it a bit easier to proc. Fill in some of the stats with the barrel - Fluted Barrel or Smallbore bump your preference between range, stability and handling. In the mag, Flared Magwell bumps stats up a bit more, or Appended Mag gets you to the maximum of 14 shots. For end-game add clearing Rapid Hit is the best choice for the first trait column support park - stacking buffs to stability and reload speed or, if you can run and slide, Slideshot partially reloads and applies passive range and stability bumps. In the second column as the signature perk, Kinetic Tremors does currently (v7.1.0.2, S21) take six hits to proc, but if that's ever given a buff, this could be great for AoE damege for a group of adds while collecting ammo and orbs remotely. Recommended MW: any, based on your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, M+KB, Controller

First-choice PvE pick for end-game use in general activities. Shapeable. Not a huge selection of Lightweight Pulse Rifles to compare with, but Chattering Bone is still best-in-class stats across the board, and provides a +20 mobility bonus and 6.25% faster movement speed. Even if it's best in class, the recoil direction still needs attention - Arrowhead Break takes it to a controllable 87, and adds a bump to handling. Either Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell in the magazine add reload speed, stability and, for the former, an extra burst. Pair that with Rapid Hit in the first trait column as the support perk, to make successive bursts easier to land and boost reload speed further. Finally, as the second column signature perk, Kinetic Tremors only needs four bursts to land to proc. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. // Apex Predator (PvE first-choice roll)
// Confined Launch, Impact Casing, Tracking Module, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2) with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against majors and bosses with short damage windows in end-game activities. Shapeable. Apex Predator has gone from the insta-shard class when it dropped, to pretty much the best rocket launcher option for putting out damage. Even though the stats are only middling, and you can't get to 10 shots - the maximum is 9, with two reserve mods, it's already in the highest subfamily for damage along with Aggressives, and is the best craftable rocket launcher in the game, as at S21. For a guided rocket, you want to velocity as low as possible, to give the shot plenty of time for course correction if your target jinks, and Confined Launch is the barrel to do that. Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage in the magazine perk slot. In the first trait column Tracking Module is very useful for hitting more mobile majors and bosses, while in the second slot as the signature perk, Enhanced Explosive Light lets you shoot seven rockets with a 25% damage boost, just for picking up orbs. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Velocity or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1851777734&perks=3194351027,3977735242


// Loaded Question (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore), (Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery), Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size just for running over a special ammo brick, or 7-8 rapid kills with another weapon overfills the magazine by up to 10 shots with Envious Assassin. Every shot in your overfilled mag, beyond it's normal limit, will trigger Reservoir Burst in the second trait slot as the signature perk, a Chain Reaction-type explosions on kills to clear adds, and +25% damage to burst down Majors and maybe the occasional boss DPS phase. Plus you can build into the Arc 3.0 blinding and jolting verb kit with an arc subclass, making this a bit of a PvE Swiss-Army Knife. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss, or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3125454907&perks=1427256713,3643424744

// THE SWARM (PvE first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. It's difficult to love the reprised SWARM for PvE when the best damage perk has been lost, and the PvE options in both trait columns are weak. The only viable use is for minor add-clear as a kind of heavy scout rifle, but if you already have an older Bottomless Grief/One For All roll, just keep that and move on. If you do want to hold on to one, you could make an argument for any barrel perk - Fluted Barrel, for the handling and stability, Polygonal Rifling, for the big stability bump or Full Bore for the range bump, for example. In the mag, Appended Mag adds extra bullets, Flared Magwell adds straight stability and Reload Speed or Tactical Mag does both. In the first trait column as the support perk, Feeding Frenzy and Well Rounded are the best of a limited bunch, while in the second slot as the signature perk, Golden Tricorn is much the only choice - a straight 15% damage boost on kills that can be boosted to 50% with an arc ability kill for occasional burst damage against Majors. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2759590322&perks=2610012052,2779035018

// BrayTech Osprey (PvE first-choice roll)
// Volatile Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Cluster Bombs, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. High-Impact Rocket Launchers are meant for add-clear - they have the highest blast radius stat of the subfamilies and do middling damage - 10% less than Adaptives or Aggressives. And saying that, BrayTech Osprey has the worst stats in its subfamily. So, would you really use a rocket launcher for add clear? If the answer is yes (not sure it should be, but you go girl/boy/bot/peep), then use the barrel and mag to get to 100 blast radius without hurting velocity, and add Cluster Bombs and Chain Reaction for as much destruction as possible over as wide an area as possible. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3667553455&perks=1275731761,2396489472

// The Immortal (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore), (Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), (Threat Detector, Surplus, Perpetual Motion), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities, particularly with a Strand subclass. While you've probably been melted a few times in PvP with The Immortal, it's still interesting in PvE as the first aggressive frame Strand SMG (the same subfamily as Ikelos).It's an absolute stat monster and the support perks can make it even more so, so we'll start with a range-boosting barrel, and any of the "Rounds" magazines. In the first trait column for the support perk, Threat Detector, Surplus (particularly easy to maintain with the extra melee charges from Strand), or Perpetual Motion will bump gunfeel stats up. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. In the second column, Hatchling is the natural choice to pair with a Strand subclass to generate Threadlings for add control. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// The Messenger (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), (Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion), Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear use in end-game activities. The reprised Messenger has a few new tricks for Season 21, which make it worth a look. Good stats across the board, except for recoil direction, which we can help out with Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot, which takes it to a controllable 90. For the magazine perk, any of the "Rounds" mags or Flared Magwell work well. For your first trait column support perk, Rapid Hit and Perpetual Motion can both layer on addition gunfeel boosts on top. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. Finally, in the second slot, the new-for-Lightfall Kinetic Tremors as the signature perk adds bonus AoE damage for 12 hits (or four bursts), damaging your target and any adds within 5m. Recommended MW: any will work, depending on your preference, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Unexpected Resurgence (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Auxiliary Reserves, Supercooled Accelerator), (Appended Mag, Accurized Rounds, Light Mag, Alloy Mag), Replenishing Aegis, Unstoppable Force
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for chunky add-clear use in endgame activities. The stats on Unexpected Resurgence make it the best adaptive glaive in the sandbox as at Season 21. Every Haft choice involves a trade-off but for most, the improved shield from Auxiliary Reserves, or maybe the range (which = projectile speed) from Supercooled Accelerator, are worth the penalty to reload speed, which we can get around. In the mag, Appended Mag for the extra shot (Extended doesn't do anything more for you), or Accurized Rounds for the range are options, and if reload speed is still a worry, Light Mag or Alloy Mag help out. In the first trait column as the support park, the new-to-Lightfall Replenishing Aegis partially refills the mag on shield damage, and Unstoppable Force as the second column signature perk is a natural pairing, boosting damage by 20% for blocking the same damage with your shield. As an arc speacial weapon, you can also build into blinding and Jolting verbs with an arc subclass, and don't forget the Alacrity origin trait for solo content to pretty much max out range and reload speed, and add 10 Aim Assist too. //notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for chunky add-clear use in endgame activities. The stats on Unexpected Resurgence make it the best adaptive glaive in the sandbox as at Season 21. Every Haft choice involves a trade-off but for most, the improved shield from Auxiliary Reserves, or maybe the range (which = projectile speed) from Supercooled Accelerator, are worth the penalty to reload speed, which we can get around. In the mag, Appended Mag for the extra shot (Extended doesn't do anything more for you), or Accurized Rounds for the range are options, and if reload speed is still a worry, Light Mag or Alloy Mag help out. In the first trait column as the support park, the new-to-Lightfall Replenishing Aegis partially refills the mag on shield damage, and Unstoppable Force as the second column signature perk is a natural pairing, boosting damage by 20% for blocking the same damage with your shield. As an arc speacial weapon, you can also build into blinding and Jolting verbs with an arc subclass, and don't forget the Alacrity origin trait for solo content to pretty much max out range and reload speed, and add 10 Aim Assist too. I expect to have a lot of dumb fun with this gun in PVE, especially in activities with a Strand surge (AKA all of them this season). Warlocks in particular should enjoy this combo, especially with Thread of Evolution, the Classy Contender trait, and an Empowering rift. That being said, Threadlings aren't the strongest choice for endgame PVE, and Lightweight frame scouts aren't my favorite in GMs either, so I expect this will just be a roll for fun, rather than a top tier PVE weapon. // The Title (PvE first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected (maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons 😉). Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong. Similarly with Surrounded as your second column signature perk - although it's not the Enhanced version, you'll still have 40% bonus damage when procced in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Taraxippos (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel takes it to a manageable 84. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed (and an extra shot for Tac Mag). Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk adds 30% damage with no falloff, and is useful when Scouts are the seasonal anti-Overload Champion mod, only needing two shots to disrupt. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Champion, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=1354429876,3038247973


// Taraxippos (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Fourth Time's The Charm, Outlaw), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed (and an extra shot for Tac Mag). Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, or Outlaw works well for a snappy reload after a crit kill. Then Hatchling in the second column as the signature perk builds into the Strand toolkit - just come to peace that they're likely to be spawned too far away to join you, if you're a Warlock. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Rufus's Fury (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds), Rewind Rounds, (Target Lock, Frenzy)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with signature perks like Target Lock, where the refilled magazine allows you to reach the higher damage stacks, for damage against bulkier enemies or Frenzy for a general 15% damage bump. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Mykel's Reverence (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), Rewind Rounds, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Mykel's Reverence is no different - this is the best rapid-fire sidearm. With a Recoil Direction of 96, you can spec into your preference of Range, Stability and/or Reload Speed in the barrel and magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Frenzy as the second column signature perk to effectively extend the magazine and keep the 15% damage boost going. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy against Majors in end-game content. As your first trait column support perk, Demolitionist means grenades (remember, it's 20% grenade energy for special weapon kills), which means you should have an easy way to proc Paracausal Affinity for 20% bonus damage for 6s to clear beefier Minors, and Majors. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Koraxis's Distress (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Linear Compensator, Quick Launch), Spike Grenades, Chain Reactions, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, Linear Compensator adds a little extra Blast Radius (let's face it, you'll want to catch as many adds as possible in an explosion), or Quick Launch just goes all in for velocity in the barrel. If you do catch a chunkier enemy, Spike Grenades is nice for a little extra impact damage, and then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Velocity - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, Linear Compensator adds a little extra Blast Radius (let's face it, you'll want to catch as many adds as possible in an explosion), or Quick Launch just goes all in for velocity in the barrel. If you do catch a chunkier enemy, Spike Grenades is nice for a little extra impact damage, and then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Velocity - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

In the mag, Flared Magwell or maybe Appended Mag are probably the best picks - Light Mag isn't bad either. Feeding Frenzy as your support perk in the first trait column will speed up reloads still further after kills, while Headstone as your signature perk in the second trait column generates your Stasis crystal on a crit kill to use your subclass fragments with. // Irukandji (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling), (Steady Rounds, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Envious Assassing, Fourth Time's The Charm, Rapid Hit), (Firing Line, Focused Fury)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in a fireteam in end-game content. The Season 20 Veist weapon is a rapid-fire sniper rifle with as-expected lowish stats, as a World drop weapon. Irukandji (a small, rare, highly venomous jellyfish from Australia, because of course it would be) does benefit from the Veist Stinger origin trait which is occasionally useful even in its nerfed state. Remember that as at Season 20, this will do less base damage than an equivalent kinetic weapon so, to be competitive, you'll need the parks to fall your way. The main issue you'll find is with keeping the reticule on a boss's crit spot - you'll need to boost Recoil Direction and Stability to make this easier, so Arrowhead Brake or Polygonal Rifling are your barrel perk choices, and Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Steady Rounds (you're not likely to be outside of the damage falloff distance, even with the range penalty) should be your mag perk options. As your first trait column support perk, Envious Assassin overflows your magazine passively with primary and power weapon kills, Fourth Time's The Charm works extends the magazine if you hit crits consistently, or Rapid Hit improves stability (and reload speed) as you fire to keep your reticule steadier. In the signature perk, second column trait, Firing Line is more forgiving of an occasional missed shot when you're in a fireteam but, if you're flying solo, Focused Fury will boost damage in the bottom half of your magazine if you can hit your crits consistently. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-PvE-MajorSpec, BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C (named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking), a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control and, even with 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will still provide some extra impact damage as your mag perk. Envious Assassin overflows the magazine from primary and special weapon skills so you can take full advantage of the Enhanced Explosive Light's extra stack of damage over the standard version and have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

If you looking for a fun add-clear weapon for bulkier minors, with an eye towards Incandescent as your signature perk in the second trait slot, then maximise your Blast Radius with your barrel and mag perks, and masterwork - Volatile Launch or Confined Launch with High-Explosive Ordnance. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Suros weapon for season 20 is the Coronach (named after a funeral dirge sung, or played on the bagpipes, in Scotland and Ireland), a solar Adaptive auto rifle with the lowish stats you'd expect from a World drop. The Suros origin trait can help fill in a little Handling and flinch resistance after a reload although it's more commonly thought of as being more PvP-focussed. If you didn't pick up an Ammit with Incandescent from Witch Queen, this gives you access to a similar (if unenhanced) set of perks. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk takes Recoil Direction to 100 and adds Handling for snappiness. To fill in the other gunfeel stats, Flared Magwell boosts Stability and Reload Speed, or Light Mag boosts Range and Reload Speed in the mag. As the support perk, in the first trait column, Feeding Frenzy boosts reload speed further after kills - your solar ignition kills from Incandescent will add to the stacks, particularly when paired with Ember of Ashes. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

Although generally more of a PvP perk, Zen Moment as the support perk helps with the lowish stability to keep shots on target for Target Lock's stacking damage boost. // Perpetualis (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Extended Barrel, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Keep Away, Zen Moment), Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. This is the easier to get Strand adaptive auto-rifle for Season of Defiance, if you're unable to get into the Root of Nightmares Raid. The stats are decent, although both stability and handling are a little below par, and the recoil direction could maybe do with a little help, although the Noble Deeds origin perk can help out with the handling (and boost reload speed too). Extended Barrel or Smallbore are your best barrel choices, and Tactical Mag is the best of the mag perks. In the first trait column, there aren't many support perks that help in PvE - Keep Away is the pick of a limited budget, or possibly the reworked Zen Moment. For your second trait column signature perk, Golden Tricorn is unique (as at v7.0.0.6, anyway) on a Strand auto rifle and the second stack isn't too difficult to proc by either using a grapple melee or shooting a Tangle, for a massive 50% damage boost for 10s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Raconteur (PvE first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Compact Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. Shapeable. Our first Stasis Precision Bow, with competitive stats by comparison with the other kinetic slot options, although Accuracy is the lowest of all the Precisions. Your aim with the Bowstring and Arrow, as ever, is to reduce the draw time, while not harming your accuracy or handling. Elastic String is the best for as low a draw time as possible and helps Handling too, at the cost of Accuracy, which you can recover with an Accuracy Masterwork, while Compact Arrow Shaft boosts handling and reload speed. Don't forget, the Noble Deeds origin perk will also boost both as well. If you ever see Archer's Tempo as the support perk in the first trait column then you don't need to look much further. Similarly, Explosive Head adds damage (and flinch) for free so is the best signature perk in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Accuracy or Draw Time, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Royal Executioner (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option to control the bolts, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is the stand out support perk in the first trait column - overflow the magazine with primary and power weapon kills, and this is the only non-Raid fusion rifle that you can do that with. Every overflowed shot will then do 25% bonus damage with Reservoir Burst as your second trait column, signature perk, as well as making enemies explode, making this great for both add-clearing groups of minors and burst damage against majors. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Prodigal Return (PvE first-choice roll)

//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add suppression in end-game activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. For add control, Disorienting Grenades give you breathing space in a firefight. Pair that with Envious Assassin, which can give you up to three in the barrel(!) as your support perk in the first trait column, and Disruption Break, for 50% bonus kinetic damage to burst down chunkier red bar Minors and the occasional Major while they stumble around as the signature perk, and you probably have the perfect add control breach-loading GL. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling (for faster swaps) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

With one eye towards building a weapon around Voltshot (this is the first GL with Voltshot as an option, although the jury is still out on whether that's a good idea or not) as the signature perk in the second trait column, we'll need to make the reload as fast as possible. High Velocity Rounds boosts reload speed as well as velocity. Then Threat Detector or Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column helps too. Using Spark of Beacons gives you arc Blinding on a kill, which should make the follow-up shot after a kill, to get your Jolt damage tick, easier to hit. This combination should make you a bit of a walking tank in add-dense areas, as long as you have ammo. // Caretaker (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, (Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and minor add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 (except DSC's Bequest), and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support perk in the first trait column, both Tireless Blade and Relentless Strikes work but, once you get Incandescent working (and Ember of Ashes helps) as your signature perk in the second trait column, the ignite kills among adds count towards Tireless Blade kills, so that will be the more efficient way to regain ammo. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2). First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. Reconstruction, Subsistence or Slideways all help you keep your magazine topped up so you can take advantage of the damage boost from Golden Tricorn. With this being a stasis weapon, the second stack is tough to proc, but the 15% extra damage from one stack is reliable and refreshable. The Omolon origin trait is useful in the top half of the mag, to help with reloads and a bit of extra stability too. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability, Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Fioritura-59 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Pugilist, Golden Tricorn

First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in endgame content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds (you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time), or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. Pugilist can help recharge your melee for Golden Tricorn - you get a solid 15% extra damage for one stack after a kill or a hefty 50% bonus with an ability kill while the first stack is procced. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

First-choice PvE roll for stasis subclasses in end-game content. Even nerfed, the Veist Stinger origin trait will still be useful occasionally. Finally, for Stasis synergy, in the second trait column Headstone's crystals work with your aspects and fragments. //Round Robin
//notes: Datto's Thoughts, Round Robin is a strand, 120 RPM hand cannon. We have a lot of new perks with Lightfall and arguably one of the top rolls on this gun consists of 2 new perks: Keep Away and Hatchling. Keep Away is the opposite of Threat Detector, you get bonus stats when there is NOTHING near you, minus allies. Hatchling is where precision final blows or rapid non-precision kills spawn a Threadling at the target's location. In the first column, we have soem good stuff, Keep Away, Subsistence and Envious Assassin, another good perk, where rapidly killing targets with other guns will transfer ammo into this gun from reserves and this can overflow the magazine. At the moment, I feel like this is much more of a special weapon type perk, but I wouldn't begrudge you for using it as we feel it out. The second column has Hatchling, Kill Clip and Golden Tricorn. Golden Tricorn is definitely a bit better of a pick now thanks to 3.0 subclasses and the general up time you can have on grenades and melees nowadays. I think Hatchling is quite popular right now because it's new and it links up with Strand and there are Strand fragments to buff Threadlings, so if it fits with your build, it is certainly worth a try. Threadlings WILL proc Golden Tricorn if they are from Threadling Grenade. This gun just kicks pretty hard, it's a 120 so that makes sense, so I'm gonna be going with stability based minor perks and masterwork. I have heard good things about this gun in PvP with Keep Away and Kill Clip, but I have not tested it myself just yet. Again, it does kick pretty hard. pve. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JlV7QZ5P0Mk&t=43s

// Basso Ostinato
//notes: Datto's Thoughts, Basso Ostinato, a void shotgun, 140 RPM, rapid fire. Shotguns in PvE world are a bit weird, not really super popular at the moment, but I feel like with the difficulty increases, they're going to be a better mid-tier difficulty weapon class, stuff that's around -10, -15. In any case, This gun has 3 premier perks in the second column, One Two Punch, Trench Barrel, and new with Lightfall, Destabilizing Rounds, where final blows cause nearby targets to become Volatile. Anything with the word Volatile immediately is gonna perk some ears up and this is definitely the most popular perk on this gun at the moment for you void enjoyers out there. That being said, after running with this gun and this perk for a little bit, I wasn't exactly the most impressive, but I also wasn't optimized for its use pretty much at all, so there's probably some more investigating to be done. However, I'm skeptical. In the first column, Envious Assassin isn't a bad choice at all, Lead from Gold also getting a lot of love here, although I dunno if it's my favorite. Don't sleep on Grave Robber either, you're gonna be in melee range with this thing anyway so might as well get some free reloads. I think One-Two Punch is probably better on a harder hitting shotty, the faster ones feel like a more trigger happy kinda gun. You can certainly make arguments for both rapid fire and high impact shotguns in terms of 1-2 Punch viability. I think most people are gonna hunt Destabilizing Rounds to try them out while the perk is still new though, but if it ends up not being good, then 1-2 Punch or Trench Barrel. // Albruna-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "For any PvE activity I will always try and prioritize recoil direction. The usual suspects of triple tap, clown cartridge and field prep all make their appearance. Alongside our usual damage perks; firing line, frenzy and vorpal weapon. All of these damage perks are phenomenal, but use case specific. Firing line only works when in a full fireteam or raid, and you’d have to be within range for it to work. Frenzy only really works as long as you’re continuously taking damage or dealing it. Vorpal is the easiest to work with but also has the lowest damage output of all three." JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Close to Melee was just built for glaives - projectile kills improve melee damage by 30%, and more kills with either projectile or melee extend the timer. Proc and go have fun. // Retrofit Escapade (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, (Stats for All, Field Prep, Feeding Frenzy), Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Backup PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, or boost stability with your barrel perk. Add your choice of extra shots, stability and reload speed with the mag. For end-game add clear, use Stats for All, Field Prep, or Feeding Frenzy for maximum uptime in your first trait column, and the reliable Frenzy in the second for an easy to use 15% damage boost. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Fire and Forget (PvE first-choice roll)
(Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), Enhanced Battery, Field Prep, (Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game boss DPS. Shapeable. Veist Stinger is the origin trait to use, as it procs per shot rather than per burst, which means you'll probably never need to reload. F&F is a non-endgame obtainable  boss-killing replacement for Reed's Regret, and a aggressive-frame companion to Stormchaser. Being a stasis LFR, it's easy to get a Font of Might 25% boost to your damage if you have a Warlock putting down a Well and willing to use the Supreme Wellmaker mod, and you're using the Elemental Shards and Elemental Time Dilation mods. You'll need to keep your shots on a boss's crit spot, so maximise your stability with your barrel, and then add in an extra charge with no downsides with Enhanced Battery. For major or boss damage, use Field Prep to boost your ammo reserves (which you'll be calling on with Veist Stinger). Frenzy is an easily procced 15% damage boost just for being in combat, or Vorpal Weapon is an uncomplicated 10% boost against Majors and Bosses. Recommended  MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Avalanche (PvE first-choice roll)
(Arrowhead Brake. Fluted Barrel), (Extended Mag, Appended Mag), Ambitious Assassin, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for chunkier Minors with a Solar subclass in endgame content. Option of Suros Synergy or the Dawning Surprise origin trait which can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. // Jurassic Green (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Perpetual Motion, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle as at v6.2.5.1, but it's the only solar one currently available. Wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction barrel, Stability Barrel or a bit of both. Take your choice of the combat-effect mag perks in your mag slot. For endgame use, Perpetual Motion boosts gunfeel stats passively and Frenzy provides a decent 15% damage boost in combat. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. // Commemoration (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag), Subsistence, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Tactical, Appended or Extended Mag. Killing Tally is the easiest to proc damage boosting perk if you're killing adds - 3 kills equals 30% bonus damage until you stow or reload, which you won't have to do much with Subsistence refreshing your magazine, so you could keep firing until you're empty. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Appended or Extended Mag, reload speed with Flared Magwell or Alloy Mag, or both with Tactical Mag. For add clear, you need a reload perk or mag extending perk in your first trait column - Subsistence, Fourth Times The Charm, Reconstruction, Rapid Hit or Feeding Frenzy all work with good old Rampage to boost damage by up to 33%. // Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for major or boss damage in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). The standout stat here is impact, which is 10 points higher than for any other adaptive sword, which makes it competitive in end-game content for chunkier adds. Jagged Edge adds more damage and Swordmaster's Guard increases you heavy attack charge rate. For major or boss damage in a crowd - think Duality - Relentless Strikes returns ammo for every three hits, and Surrounded boosts damage by 36.5% (47% for the Enhanced Park. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// The Militia's Birthright (PvE first-choice roll)
// Quick Launch, Blinding Grenades, (Quickdraw, Lead From Gold), Auto-Loading Holster
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE first-choice roll for minor add control in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a Blinding Grenade roll on an Ignition Code or Pardon Our Dust. Handling and Velocity are what you need in your barrel, and Quick Launch delivers both. Blinding Grenades is always great for easier add control, particularly in crowds, and there's a case for both Quickdraw or Lead From Gold in your first trait column, paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the second so that you always have a shot ready. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling - there's really nothing much a mod can add directly as you're not aiming for kills, so maybe Backup Mag mod's increase ammo reserves is the best option, but feel free to plug in what works for you. |tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. //notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content, particularly for Barrier Champions or solar burn activities. Shapeable. Good stats by comparison with other energy Precision frame ARs. Focus on Handling or Stability in the barrel, as with the Precision Frame you don't need to worry about Recoil Direction,  and Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage against shields. For end-game content, especially when the relevant anti-Barrier Champion mod's around or in solar burn activities, Adaptive Munitions will quickly take down barriers and shields, and Turnabout gives you an overshield. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-Champion, PvE-Solo, Controller, MKB

// Taipan-4fr (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), Enhanced Battery, (Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap, Field Prep), Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against majors and Champions in end-game content. Shapeable. An end-game LFR that you don't need to complete a Raid, Dungeon or Trials for, which works for both burst and sustained damage, especially with the Veist Stinger origin trait throwing in extra shots for free at random. A Handling barrel just makes using it snappier, and Enhanced Battery adds a shot with no downsides, to give the origin trait an extra chance to proc. For solo or against more mobile bosses, take your choice of Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap or Field Prep with Frenzy, so you don't need to worry about how close your are to the rest of your fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, PvE-Champion, Controller, MKB

// Taipan-4fr (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), Enhanced Battery, Triple Tap, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for sustained damage against bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. An end-game LFR that you don't need to complete a Raid, Dungeon or Trials for, which works for both burst and sustained damage, especially with the Veist Stinger origin trait throwing in extra shots for free at random. A Handling barrel just makes using it snappier, and Enhanced Battery with Backup Mag gets you to the magic seven shots in your battery, to give the origin trait ten shots with Triple Tap to proc if you hit crits. For Raid bosses or static bosses, where you'll be in a fireteam as a group, Firing Line adds a solid 20% bonus damage. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, MKB

// Allied Demand
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE Controller \ M+KB): Recommended MW: Reload “Allied Demand is a great weapon to see come back. I love the 300 rpm adaptive frame sidearms. Something about them just feels best. Not quite the bullet hoses of the 450s, a little less fatiguing on the finger than the 360s, and feel better than the 260s for me. In PvE I really would not take a sidearm into any serious activities. They just do not have the damage or the range you would want to make them feel as effective. To make this sidearm feel as good as possible I would recommend bumping up the handling and stability. Sure you will not be able to shoot as far, but you are using a sidearm. Be real here. Frenzy is great for getting that quick damage and reload. With such a small mag another great shout is multikill clip to keep damage stacks after each kill.“ (Year 5 S18: Season of Plunder Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo)|tags:PvE, Controller, M+KB

// Out of Bounds
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE Controller \ M+KB): Recommended MW: Reload “The newest crucible weapon is only the slightest bit a disappointment for me. it is an Omolon 900 without phase mag. If you were not around in d2y1 or missed getting a good Stochastic Variable in Season of the Splicer, phase mag is a special Omolon magazine that drops the rpm from 900 (lightweight) to 600 (precision), and increases the damage profile to match the precision frames. The smg keeps its other stats, and retains the lightweight profile, but just hits like a precision frame. Not having that on an Omolon smg just feels wrong. Especially when it is not going to be better than regular lightweights or precision frame smgs. I digress. In most activities you will either have on Funnelweb or CALUS-Mini Tool. Out of Bounds acts as an arc alternative. With how good some arc 3.0 ability cycling is, you can almost guarantee two stacks of golden tricorn. Paired with subsistence to really tear down hordes of enemies. Out of Bounds is not going to be the best, and getting one is going to take some time. But it might just be one of the best arc weapons to use with the new subclasses.“ (Year 5 S18: Season of Plunder Arc Submachine Gun Primary Ammo)|tags:PvE, Controller, M+KB

// Smite of Merain (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Focused Fury, Dragonfly
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32.  PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Excellent in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Arrowhead Brake will straighten up the recoil direction, but to be honest you could go with boosts to stability or handling instead. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell help with stability and reload speed. For endgame content, it's unusual to be able to have two damage perks on a weapon, but Focused Fury can pair well with Firefly for dealing with groups of Minor adds and the occasional Major. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major, or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB

// Doom of Chelchis (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Adaptive Munitions, (Frenzy, Focused Fury)
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! With a Precision Frame, you won't need to worry too much about recoil direction, and you already have tonnes of range, so focus on Stability and Handling, with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to help further with stability and reload speed. Adaptive Munitions is S-Tier in endgame, match game, content and when paired with a damage-boosting trait like Frenzy or Focused Fury, you have everything you need for enemies (shileded or not) in end-game content. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major, or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB

It's rare to be able to roll two damage perks so if you're looking for something that you can use against Minor adds, the occasional Major or Champion, then Explosive Payload or Vorpal Weapon, in combination with Frenzy or Focused Fury should give you pretty much permanent additional damage uptime.  Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Adept Big Ones, or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-Champion, Controller, MKB

// Qullim's Terminus (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Stats For All, Heating Up, Unrelenting), Headstone
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Stasis builds in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell are both good choices in the mag slot. Treat this as a heavy Scout Rifle for dealing with beefier adds and choose your traits accordingly - Stats For All or Heating Up add significant gunfeel boosts, or Unrelenting helps with health regeneration. For Stasis subclasses, Headstone provides a starting point for boosting abilities, crowd control or gaining damage reduction. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-Boss, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB

// Qullim's Terminus (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel), Extended Mag, Stats For All, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Go all-in for mag size with Extended Mag to boost the benefits from the origin perk to get you close to 100 shots without reloading. Stats for All helps with gunfell and for when you finally do need to reload, but the real joy is in the Swiss-Army knife benefits of Killing Tally - three kills gets you a 30% damage buff with no time limit for the rest of the (huge) magazine or until stowed - better than either Firing Line or Focused Fury can offer - good for ripping through Minor adds, burst damage against Majors or even sustained damage against Bosses. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB

// Midha's Reckoning (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Ionised Battery, Enhanced Battery), Field Prep, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag (with Enhanced RB you only need Enhanced Battery). You can get around the reload penalty from Ionised Battery when crouching with Field Prep (and have more ammo in reserve) to use in combination with Reservoir Burst. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills (maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too) on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=1427256713,2869569095

// Midha's Reckoning (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), Accelerated Coils, (Cornered, Field Prep, Unrelenting), Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time with Cornered, add ammo reserves and faster reloads with Field Prep, or trigger health regeneration on kills with Unrelenting in the first trait column. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. Reservoir Burst procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, giving you a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills (maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too) on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB

// Midha's Reckoning (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), Accelerated Coils, Cornered, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Arc 3.0 builds in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time for burst damage against Majors with Cornered, in the first trait column. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to 13 shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. Golden Tricorn x2 boosts damage by 50% for 10s, to melt Majors and the occasional Boss (maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too). Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB

// The Comedian (PvE first choice roll)
// (Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag), (Lead From Gold, Subsistence), (Vorpal Weapon, Trench Barrel)
//notes:Inspired by DMB Player Versus Enemies Podcast 12. PvE first-choice for general use. Bad stats generally, and sub-optimal damage output as at Season 16 - rapid fire subtypes are generally better picks.
